title: Problems: Gauss Theorem
description: Answer all questions. Each carries 1 mark. Choose the most appropriate option.

questions.title: Let $Q$ be the solid bounded by the cylinder $x^{2} + y^{2} = 4$, the plane $x + z = 6$, and the $xy$–plane, as shown in the figure. Evaluate the surface integral $$ \iint_{S} \mathbf{F} \cdot \mathbf{N} \, dS, $$ where $S$ is the surface of $Q$ and $$ \mathbf{F}(x,y,z) = (x^{2} + \sin z)\,\mathbf{i} + (xy + \cos z)\,\mathbf{j} + e^{y}\,\mathbf{k}. $$

Let $Q$ be the solid bounded by the coordinate planes and the plane $$ 2x + 2y + z = 6. $$ Evaluate the surface integral $$ \iint_{S} \mathbf{F} \cdot \mathbf{N}\, dS, $$ where $S$ is the surface of $Q$ and $$ \mathbf{F} = x\,\mathbf{i} + y^{2}\,\mathbf{j} + z\,\mathbf{k}. $$

Let $Q$ be the solid region bounded above by the paraboloid $$ z = 4 - x^{2} - y^{2}, $$ and below by the $xy$–plane. Evaluate the surface integral $$ \iint_{S} \mathbf{F} \cdot \mathbf{N} \, dS, $$ where $$ \mathbf{F}(x,y,z) = 2z\,\mathbf{i} + x\,\mathbf{j} + y^{2}\,\mathbf{k}. $$
